revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Top Global |model=MB6800 |revision= |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=07/11/2007 |manuf_country=China |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=wireless router |fcc_id=SUMMB6800 |ic_id= |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=3 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model= |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1= |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1= |ram1_brand=GLT |ram1_model= |ram1_num=2 |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types=PCMCIA (32-bit) |expansion_pcmcia_num=1 |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model= |wi1_chip2_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip2_model=BCM2050 |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bg |wi1_ant_conn=RP-SMA |wi1_txchains= |wi1_rxchains= |wi1_sstreams= |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu= |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Infineon |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |flags=3G capable |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bg |default_ssid=topglobalXXXXXX |default_ssid_regex=^topglobal[0-9]{6}$ |default_ip=172.16.0.1 |default_user=public |default_pass=public |oui= |oui_eth= }} {{TagLine|3G Mobile Router}} :[http://www.topglobalusa.com/mb6800.htm Product page]{{â€¢}}[http://www.topglobalusa.com/download/MB6800%20User%20Guide.pdf User Guide]
"MB6800-V1" and "2006-"??"-"?? appears to be silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos.
There appears to be a '''TI''' CardBus controller on the board. The '''Broadcom''' WiSoC also appears to be BCM4712 (BCM4712KFB), but I was not aware this SoC had a PCI interface...
Per the manual (FCC and non), the default SSID is '''topglobal''' followed by the last 6 digits of the device's serial number.
There are considerable similarities between the Web UI used by '''Top Global''' and '''m0n0wall''' (and other '''m0n0wall''' based distros).
